Police say missing woman last seen in Ngāruawāhia could be in Nelson https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/police-say-missing-woman-last-seen-in-ngaruawahia-could-be-in-nelson/6LJATLDIH5GQDNUB2X6E64ZVQE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/police-say-missing-woman-last-seen-in-ngaruawahia-could-be-in-nelson/6LJATLDIH5GQDNUB2X6E64ZVQE/ Police say Gracie was last seen on January 17 around Fairmont St, Ngāruawāhia. Fri, 24 Jan 2025 03:38:48 +0000 Police are appealing for help from the public to locate missing woman Gracie who was last seen in Ngāruawāhia.
YMP Waka Ama win 6 golds, 2 silver medals at national championships https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/sport/ymp-waka-ama-win-6-golds-2-silver-medals-at-national-championships/QJ6A6U74TJAQPMIESQB2QZ7GBY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/sport/ymp-waka-ama-win-6-golds-2-silver-medals-at-national-championships/QJ6A6U74TJAQPMIESQB2QZ7GBY/ John GilliesYMP Waka Ama Club dominated the junior races at the sprint nationals. Here's why. Fri, 24 Jan 2025 03:32:14 +0000 A mixed boys' and girls' team from YMP Waka Ama, Te Pāhou-Pīpīwhākao, won the Tairāwhiti district's first gold medal of the Waka Ama NZ Sprint Nationals at Lake Karapiro last week. They won the taitama (midget boys') W12 250m te ihu (championship) final on the Monday. Team members are, standing (from left): Te Waikohurangi Ria-Smith, Ishaan Tarawa-Onekawa, Hinewaiapu Taumaunu-Boyd, Hinemaia Ria and Asher Smith. Front: Rohan Tarawa-Onekawa, Hunter O’Connell, Beau Jones, Manaia Tarawa-Onekawa, Letty Porter-Wood, Aterea Anderson and Tahumanawa-Ora Hape. Standing at the back is Tuku Morgan, chairman of the executive board of the governing council of the Waikato Tainui tribal confederation.
